meanings.definition: To grant or convey (property) by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: He feoffed his friend with a small piece of land.
meanings.sent2: The king feoffed the knight with a large estate.
meanings.sent3: The farmer feoffed his chickens with tiny crowns for fun.
meanings.sent4: She feoffed her cat with the title of 'Lord of the House'.
meanings.sent5: The magician feoffed the audience with a sense of wonder and awe.

meanings.definition: To invest with a fee or feud.
meanings.sent1: The lord feoffed his loyal vassal with a portion of his land.
meanings.sent2: The nobleman feoffed his eldest son with the family's ancestral sword.
meanings.sent3: The chef feoffed the kitchen apprentice with the secret recipe for the famous dish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher feoffed the student with the responsibility of leading the class project.
meanings.sent5: The coach feoffed the team captain with the authority to make game-time decisions.
